qas.question: What was Kerry's role in the Yale Political Union as a junior?
What secret society did Kerry join?
What country did Kerry visit as a student?
Who was Kerry's most influential professor?
What was Kerry's role in the Yale Political Union as a sophomore?

context: In his sophomore year, Kerry became the <a4_0>Chairman of the Liberal Party<a4_0/> of the Yale Political Union, and a year later he served as <a0_0>President of the Union<a0_0/>. Amongst his influential teachers in this period was Professor <a3_0>H. Bradford Westerfield<a3_0/>, who was himself a former President of the Political Union. His involvement with the Political Union gave him an opportunity to be involved with important issues of the day, such as the civil rights movement and the New Frontier program. He also became a member of the secretive <a1_0>Skull and Bones Society<a1_0/>, and traveled to <a2_0>Switzerland<a2_0/> through AIESEC Yale.
